intro: Nectandra lanceolata var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved sandarac tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a fragrant resin, which has been historically used in incense and medicinal applications. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional contexts.
